that's a two part answer.  One, there is desktop restoration.  this runs whatever was running the last time you shut down.
then there are . files in your home directory you can use to start apps when X runs, but by default they are empty.
doesn't necessarily matter, depends on how the desktop is configured.  You don't have to explicitly save
the files you will care about are in the .gnome directory under your home directory
if you remove the entire .gnome directory it will be returned to the state it was in the first time you logged in.
check other . directories.  Also make sure you use -A with ls to see hidden (dot) files in the subdirectories.
